headline: India Looks Hopefully to the Moon Ahead of Chandrayaan-2 Landing
abstract: On Saturday, India could become the fourth country ever to land on the lunar surface.
lead_paragraph: BANGALORE, India — India is within reach of the moon.

headline: Trump Moves to Send Mortgage Giants Back to Private Sector
abstract: A long-awaited plan from the Trump administration would return Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to the private sector, with a government guarantee.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration on Thursday unveiled a long-awaited plan to end federal control of two mortgage giants that had been bailed out by taxpayers during the 2008 financial crisis and return them to the private sector.

headline: Feared Missing in the Bahamas: 23 Relatives of Sidney Poitier
abstract: A nephew of the acclaimed Bahamian-American actor said that he has been searching for his sister and her children, among others, since the hurricane hit: “We haven’t been able to find any of them.”
lead_paragraph: In the aftermath of Hurricane Dorian, which left the Bahamas splintered and overcome with flooding, one prominent family with extensive connections in the islands has spent a week trying to account for missing relatives — and to maintain hope.

headline: Have We Hit Peak Vape Panic?
abstract: The war on e-cigarettes just escalated.
lead_paragraph: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it Tuesdays and Thursdays.

headline: ‘The Energy Was Just Indescribable’: Club Langston Didn’t Go Quietly
abstract: Located on an unassuming block in Brooklyn, one of the last black-owned gay nightclubs in the city has closed.
lead_paragraph: In the daytime, Club Langston was easy to miss. There was no sign, only two unmarked black and white doors. The biggest landmark was the nearby auto parts shop.

headline: New York State Suspects Vitamin E May Have Played a Role in Vaping Illnesses
abstract: Health officials around the country are still investigating numerous possible causes and have tested only some of the devices used by ill patients.
lead_paragraph: Health officials in New York State said on Thursday that they are investigating a possible cause of a recent surge in severe vaping-related illnesses: a compound called vitamin E acetate.

headline: Trumpism Is Bad for Business
abstract: It’s hard to make plans when the rules keep changing.
lead_paragraph: With each passing week it becomes ever clearer that Donald Trump’s trade war, far from being “good, and easy to win,” is damaging large parts of the U.S. economy. Farmers are facing financial disaster; manufacturing, which Trump’s policies were supposed to revive, is contracting; consumer confidence is plunging, largely because the public (rightly) fears that tariffs will raise prices.

headline: Rats Have Ruled New York for 355 Years. Can a Mystery Bucket Stop Them?
abstract: New York’s so-called war on rats is as old as the city itself, but the methods keep changing.
lead_paragraph: Traps. Poison. Birth control. Dry ice. And now, what city officials are touting as a high-tech solution: drowning.

headline: Markets Soar on News of China Talks, but Hopes for Progress Are Low
abstract: Stocks rebounded as the United States and China scheduled further discussions, but there is little sign of tangible progress.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s decision to renew talks with China in the coming weeks sent financial markets soaring on Thursday, as investors seized on the development as a sign that both sides could still find a way out of an economically damaging trade war.

headline: Hurricane Dorian, Ghost Ship, ‘Friends’: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)

headline: Trump and Sharpie’s Maker Land in Different Kind of Storm
abstract: President Trump’s suspected use of a Sharpie on a hurricane map caused a social media storm and unexpected publicity for the marker.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The pen has never been mightier. President Donald Trump’s Sharpie pen, that is.

headline: We Still Don’t Know How Safe Vaping Is
abstract: With dozens of people becoming sick from a vaping-related illness, it’s time to get more information about the risks of e-cigarettes.
lead_paragraph: This editorial has been updated to reflect news developments.

headline: Missing Connecticut Mom: Husband’s Girlfriend Accused of Inventing Alibi
abstract: Jennifer Dulos, a mother of five, disappeared in May. Her husband and his girlfriend created fake documents listing their activities that day, the police charge.
lead_paragraph: Long before Jennifer Dulos went missing from her home in an affluent Connecticut suburb, her estranged husband’s girlfriend, Michelle C. Troconis, had moved into the Dulos home and had become ensnared in the couple’s turbulent divorce battle.

headline: LaShawn Daniels, Grammy-Winning Songwriter, Dies at 41
abstract: He wrote songs for superstars like Lady Gaga, Michael Jackson and Jennifer Lopez and was honored for his work on the Destiny’s Child hit “Say My Name.”
lead_paragraph: LaShawn Daniels, a songwriter and producer who wrote for pop megastars like Whitney Houston and Beyoncé and shared a Grammy Award in 2000 for his work on the Destiny’s Child anthem “Say My Name,” died on Tuesday in a car accident in Catawba, S.C. He was 41.

headline: On Politics With Lisa Lerer: Why House Republicans Are Bailing
abstract: You have to wonder if the Republicans’ retirements are less about spending time with families and more about spending time far away from Congress.
lead_paragraph: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host.

headline: And Now, a Word From a Fanatic
abstract: Inside the mind of an internet extremist.
lead_paragraph: I am a sick man. I am a spiteful man. I am an unattractive man. I believe my liver is diseased.

headline: Three Ex-Blackwater Guards Are Resentenced in Iraq War Massacre
abstract: The men will serve about half of their original 30-year sentences for their roles in a 2007 shooting of unarmed civilians in Iraq, which an appeals court vacated.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Three former Blackwater security contractors were sentenced on Thursday to roughly half of their original 30-year prison terms for the deadly 2007 shooting of unarmed Iraqi civilians in Baghdad’s Nisour Square, widely seen as one of the darkest moments of the Iraq war.

headline: Serena Williams Roars Back Into the U.S. Open Final
abstract: Williams easily defeated Elina Svitolina in a semifinal and will seek her record-tying 24th Grand Slam singles title on Saturday against Bianca Andreescu.
lead_paragraph: If you were a Serena Williams fan, it all looked so reassuring again on Thursday night as she pounded first serves and ripped winners on the run against an overwhelmed younger opponent to reach her 10th United States Open final in style.

headline: White House Prepares to Revoke California’s Right to Set Tougher Pollution Rules
abstract: The move is a direct challenge to California but also the latest sign the president’s broader effort to roll back fuel economy standards has fallen into disarray.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump is strongly considering a plan to revoke California’s legal authority to set state tailpipe pollution standards that are stricter than federal regulations, according to three people familiar with the matter.

headline: Hurricane Dorian Becomes a Carolina Problem With a Fierce Lashing of the Coast
abstract: After assaulting the Bahamas and skirting past Florida, the sprawling storm began sweeping north through the Carolinas.
lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — After its deadly rampage across the Bahamas and brush of Florida, Hurricane Dorian pounded the Carolinas on Thursday as its center closed in on Cape Fear, N.C., sowing fear and worry from the elegant streets of downtown Charleston to the jigsaw puzzle that is North Carolina’s barrier islands.

headline: ‘Not a Good Start, Boris’
abstract: Faced with the chaos and acrimony brought by the new prime minister, Boris Johnson, Britain’s governing institutions have proven resilient.
lead_paragraph: It may be that Britain’s political slide into Boris Johnson’s populism was inevitable in the struggle over Brexit. But his initial onslaughts against the “mother of Parliaments” have been rebuffed with laudable resolve.

headline: Don’t Trust Facebook With Your Love Life
abstract: Happiness, brought to you by the company that gave you the Cambridge Analytica Scandal™!
lead_paragraph: On Thursday, Facebook announced the start-up in the United States of Facebook Dating, a product that allows users to search for love all without the hassle of leaving the app where your angry uncle continues to share recycled memes about “Crooked Hillary.”

headline: ‘I Have Sued Exxon Mobil,’ Kamala Harris Said. Not Quite.
abstract: Ms. Harris opened an investigation of the oil giant as California’s attorney general, but critics quickly noted that no lawsuit had been filed.
lead_paragraph: For years, researchers, activists and government officials have pointed to evidence that Exxon Mobil had in-depth knowledge of the risks of fossil fuels while misleading the public about the severity of climate change.

headline: They Posed as Soldiers in Love. Over 30 People Lost $2.1 Million.
abstract: A crime ring based in Ghana swindled online victims with promises of romance and gold, officials said. A New Jersey man was arrested.
lead_paragraph: It often started with a hope for love, then quickly turned into a promise of gold. In one tragic case, it ended in death.

headline: Is Brazilian Leather Out of Fashion? H&M Stops Buying Over Amazon Fires
abstract: One of the world’s largest retailers will cease buying leather from the country, where cattle farmers are blamed for their part in accelerating deforestation.
lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — H&M, the world’s second-biggest fashion retailer, announced Thursday that it had stopped purchasing leather from Brazil over concerns that the country’s cattle industry has contributed to the deforestation of the Amazon rainforest.

headline: Environmental Justice Was a Climate Forum Theme. Here’s Why.
abstract: Democratic presidential candidates recently spoke of the need to address the adverse effects of global warming on poor and marginalized communities.
lead_paragraph: The presidential candidates at the CNN climate forum on Wednesday repeatedly emphasized how climate change is hurting low-income communities and people of color, reflecting a growing awareness among Democrats that many of the problems they seek to address are inextricably tied to racism, poverty and other forms of discrimination and inequality.

headline: Jeffrey Epstein’s Donations Create a Schism at M.I.T.’s Revered Media Lab
abstract: The proudly contrarian lab has been divided since its director disclosed that he had taken money from the disgraced financier. Its efforts at healing demonstrate lingering cultural questions.
lead_paragraph: Joichi Ito gave himself some advice in 2008: “Reminder to self,” he wrote on Twitter. “Don’t invest with or take money from creeps,” although he used an earthier term.

headline: No New School at Fort Campbell: The Money Went to Trump’s Border Wall
abstract: The Pentagon is diverting $62.6 million from the construction of a new middle school at Fort Campbell, meaning that 552 students will continue to cram themselves in at an aging school.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For almost two decades, families at Fort Campbell, the sprawling Army base along the Kentucky-Tennessee border, have borne the brunt of the country’s war efforts as a steady clip of troops with the 101st Airborne Division and from Special Operations units deployed to Afghanistan and Iraq.

headline: South African Riots Over ‘Xenophobia’ Prompt Backlash Across Africa
abstract: After rioters in Johannesburg targeted immigrants from other African countries, South Africa has been hit with boycotts and cancellations of soccer games and concerts.
lead_paragraph: DAKAR, Senegal — Pop stars have announced a boycott. Air Tanzania has suspended flights to Johannesburg. Madagascar and Zambia are refusing to send their soccer teams. Nigeria has recalled its ambassador and pulled out of a major economic forum.

headline: Review: Tom Hiddleston in a Love Triangle Undone by ‘Betrayal’
abstract: Mr. Hiddleston, Zawe Ashton and Charlie Cox portray three friends in flux in Jamie Lloyd’s revelatory interpretation of a Harold Pinter classic.
lead_paragraph: How can a naked space seem so full? Feelings furnish the stage in the resplendently spare new production of Harold Pinter’s “Betrayal,” which opened on Thursday night at the Bernard Jacobs Theater, and they shimmer, bend and change color like light streaming through a prism.

headline: Map: Hurricane Dorian’s Storm Surge
abstract: The areas that could be flooded along the coast.
lead_paragraph: The areas that could be flooded along the coast.

headline: For Second Time in 2 Weeks, Trump Awards Medal of Freedom to an Ex-N.B.A. Star
abstract: The awards to two white stars of a bygone — and far less racially diverse — basketball era are notable in light of Mr. Trump’s hostile relations with some of today’s N.B.A. stars.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump awarded the Medal of Freedom to the former N.B.A. great Jerry West on Thursday, the second time in two weeks that the president has honored a long-retired standout from a league whose current generation of stars is known for refusing to visit his White House.

headline: Corrections: September 6, 2019
abstract: Corrections appearing in print on Friday, September 6, 2019.
lead_paragraph: FRONT PAGE

headline: Quotation of the Day: French Judge Will Permit Rural Rooster to Crow On
abstract: Quotation of the Day for Friday, September 6, 2019
lead_paragraph: “This rooster was not being unbearable. He was just being himself.”

headline: Iran Will No Longer Honor Nuclear Deal’s Limits on Research
abstract: The move was Iran’s third retaliatory step since President Trump renounced the 2015 agreement.
lead_paragraph: Moving further away from the 2015 nuclear agreement, Iran said Thursday it had stopped honoring the deal’s limits on research and development, a potentially important breach of the accord.

headline: Amazon Accidentally Released Margaret Atwood’s Top-Secret ‘Handmaid’s’ Sequel
abstract: The company says a “technical error” is responsible for a “small number” of copies of “The Testaments” going out early. Independent booksellers are angry.
lead_paragraph: Josh Christie, co-owner of Print: A Bookstore in Portland, Me., has signed many a document before a book’s release. But few have come with as many Gilead-like stipulations as the affidavit for the sequel to “The Handmaid’s Tale.”

headline: Houston Man Is First to Be Charged Under Bump Stock Ban, Officials Believe
abstract: Ajay Dhingra drew the authorities’ focus after he sent an email asking former President George W. Bush to “send one of your boys to come murder me,” records show.
lead_paragraph: The authorities in Houston said Thursday that they had brought charges in what they believed to be the country’s first prosecution under a new ban on bump stocks, the attachments that enable semiautomatic rifles to fire in sustained, rapid bursts.

headline: Snack Items
abstract: Warning: This crossword by Mark Diehl might be very bad for your teeth.
lead_paragraph: FRIDAY PUZZLE — Very funny, Mark Diehl. I see what you did there. You’re trying to subliminally tempt people into eating sugary snacks for your own gain. I’m onto you.

headline: Review: In ‘Dust,’ the Measure of a Life After Suicide
abstract: A woman watches those she left behind in Milly Thomas’s unsentimental solo show at the Fourth Street Theater.
lead_paragraph: Alice is having an out-of-body experience. It is an interesting, if not particularly pleasant, one: After all, she is dead.

headline: Dallas Opera Cancels Gala Starring Plácido Domingo
abstract: The decision comes amid accusations from several women of sexual harassment by the opera star.
lead_paragraph: The Dallas Opera canceled its big-ticket March 2020 gala concert with the opera star Plácido Domingo on Thursday amid new accusations that he had sexually harassed multiple women.

headline: Biden Fund-Raiser Draws Climate Change Protesters
abstract: Joe Biden defied the activists and attended a fund-raiser co-hosted by Andrew Goldman, a founder of a fossil fuel company.
lead_paragraph: Defying criticism from climate activists, Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Thursday attended a fund-raiser co-hosted by a founder of a liquefied natural gas-related company and defended his decision to do so, despite concerns from some environmentalists that he violated the intent of a pledge to forgo money from oil and gas executives.
